speaker: DOGGETT
line: He's looking right at us. Fifty bucks says it's Lukesh and he knows we're here. Does it look like him to you?

speaker: FOLLMER
line: Let him get to the mailbox.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: It's Lukesh. I don't need him opening his mailbox to prove it.

speaker: FOLLMER
line: Patience, Agent Doggett.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: We have an agent alone with a sicko who cutting out women's tongues, a guy known for his vanishing act.

speaker: FOLLMER
line: We've got the block surrounded. He isn't vanishing anywhere. And your partner volunteered. Now, open the 4-D.

speaker: FOLLMER
line: Agent Reyes, stand by.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What the hell is this?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Monica, don't.

speaker: FOLLMER
line: Agent Reyes - keep your distance. Don't let him see you following.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Monica, where are you?

speaker: REYES
line: In a stairwell. I lost sight of him. I think he might be

speaker: REYES
line: AGHHH!

speaker: FOLLMER
line: Agent down, back stairwell, get EMS here now!

speaker: FOLLMER
line: Doggett! He's got her gun!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Erwin Lukesh! Federal Agent! Turn around, you son of a bitch.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Back here!

speaker: REYES
line: Hey!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: So, this is how the uptown crowd lives, huh?

speaker: REYES
line: This is it!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: So have you got anything really heavy that I can move for you, a dresser, a fridge.

speaker: REYES
line: No, but thank you, John, you just missed movers.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You don't say?!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I brought you a housewarming gift.

speaker: REYES
line: Hot dogs?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Polish sausage! It's the best in the city, there is a . You'll be able to walk to it.

speaker: REYES
line: Wow.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Try one.

speaker: REYES
line: Mmmm. I'm back in Gdansk.

speaker: REYES
line: Let me get some plates.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Plates? For crying out loud... who eats Polish sausage with plates?

speaker: REYES
line: Hello?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Reyes, it's AD Skinner.

speaker: REYES
line: Yes, sir?

speaker: SKINNER
line: There's no easy way to say this, I'm sorry to do it on the phone.

speaker: REYES
line: What is it?

speaker: SKINNER
line: It's Doggett. He's been found in an alley off Dillon Park. He's been shot.

speaker: REYES
line: I'm sorry, what did you say?

speaker: SKINNER
line: They're taking him in the Washington Memorial. Agent?

speaker: REYES
line: Sir, what you're saying is...

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Reyes? Agent Reyes?

speaker: REYES
line: Excuse me?

speaker: FOLLMER
line: Monica?

speaker: REYES
line: Brad? Skinner called you, too?

speaker: FOLLMER
line: He's staying at the crime scene. I'm sorry. I've been put in charge of this investigation. I promise you, it's my top priority. I will find a person who did this. I just need to find out why your partner was in that alley this morning.

speaker: REYES
line: He wasn't. He was with me, at my apartment. He was with me when Skinner called me.

speaker: FOLLMER
line: I'm not sure I'm following.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Monica, I'm so sorry. Agent Doggett is just coming out of surgery and they're moving him to the ICU.

speaker: FOLLMER
line: How's it look?

speaker: SCULLY
line: If he pulls through this, it's likely that he'll be paralysed for life.

speaker: REYES
line: I haven't understood one single word I've heard since I got here. Whoever you're talking about, it's not John Doggett.

speaker: FOLLMER
line: You have found the bullet?

speaker: SKINNER
line: 9mm slug. Found it in the alley lodged in the wall. Most likely from the Sig Sauer P226 or 228.

speaker: FOLLMER
line: Possibly FBI issue.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I don't know what you're thinking but this didn't come from Doggett's weapon. Ballistics don't match and his gun was never fired.

speaker: FOLLMER
line: Assistant Director. I'd appreciate case updates in a timely fashion. For instance, this bullet... how long have you have it? An hour? Two?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Thereabouts.

speaker: FOLLMER
line: It just we need to keep the lines of communication open, that's all I'm asking. I want this slug run through our database of FBI-issued pistols.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Like I told you the round didn't come from Doggett's weapon. You're not saying another agent could have done this.

speaker: FOLLMER
line: Just run it, please.

speaker: REYES
line: I just... I don't understand how any of this is possible. He was with me, Dana, in my apartment. How can this be?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I saw something once. It's only been the last couple of years that I've... fully come to terms with it. In '94 my father passed away... and that night... at the very moment that it happened he came to me. I like to believe that he came to say goodbye.

speaker: REYES
line: A visitation. I think that's wonderful. A blessing. But that's not what happened to me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Scully.

speaker: SKINNER
line: It's me, is Reyes with you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, she's here, we're both at the hospital.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I need you to bring her to Sixth District Police Station. I'm on my way there myself.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What's this about?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'll tell you when you get there.

speaker: REYES
line: What's going on?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Reyes, wouldn't you mind stepping inside, please?

speaker: FOLLMER
line: Hi, Monica. Have a seat.

speaker: FOLLMER
line: I wanted you and I to have a chance to talk alone to clear a few things up. A few details of your story.

speaker: REYES
line: My story?

speaker: FOLLMER
line: Well, your so certain that you were with Agent Doggett when he was shot?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What is this?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Just wait.

speaker: FOLLMER
line: Is that a true statement?

speaker: REYES
line: Yes. Uh-ah, I mean, no, I wasn't with Agent Doggett when he was shot, but I was with him at the time AD Skinner called to tell me he'd been shot.

speaker: FOLLMER
line: Look, Monica, you know how I feel. You know I'm on your side, but give me something here. Give me some... meaning... reason for what you're trying to cover up.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm going to put a stop to this.

speaker: REYES
line: What are you saying to me, Brad? Why are you saying these things?

speaker: FOLLMER
line: The results of the ballistics test. A bullet that hit Doggett came from your gun. And furthermore we have an eyewitness... one who has placed you at the scene.

speaker: REYES
line: Is that why I'm here? In this room? So you can make an ID?

speaker: FOLLMER
line: Agent Reyes...

speaker: FOLLMER
line: I'm going to have to ask you for your FBI identification.

speaker: REYES
line: Who's there? Who's back there?

speaker: POLICE OFFICER
line: We appreciate your cooperation, sir.

speaker: LUKESH
line: Anything I can do to help.

speaker: REYES
line: Smart touch. Posting a guard making sure I don't finish the job.

speaker: REYES
line: Do you really believe I did this?

speaker: SKINNER
line: No, but it doesn't matter what I believe. You may still be arrested.

speaker: REYES
line: So what are they waiting for?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Follmer's case has a couple potential holes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: For starters, there's the fact that when I called you, you were at home. Fourteen miles from the crime scene.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Plus there's the condition of your gun.

speaker: REYES
line: It hadn't been fired.

speaker: SCULLY
line: However, the bullet does match your gun. Perfectly.

speaker: REYES
line: Uh, it doesn't make any sense. None of it. What about the eyewitness? What can you tell me about him?

speaker: SKINNER
line: You know we can't discuss that.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Look...

speaker: REYES
line: My God, John.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Is he conscious?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know. It could just be a muscle spasm. It's not uncommon with this type of spinal injury.

speaker: SKINNER
line: That's not a spasm. That's Morse code.

speaker: REYES
line: What'd he say?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Lukesh.

speaker: REYES
line: What? What does that mean?

speaker: MOTHER
line: Who's there? Is somebody there? Erwin, is that you?

speaker: LUKESH
line: Who else would it be, Mama?

speaker: MOTHER
line: I thought maybe robbers... My God, I thought something terrible had happened to you. You were gone so long.

speaker: LUKESH
line: I was gone 2 hours and 6 minutes and back at noon, just like I told you.

speaker: MOTHER
line: I was so scared. Could you bring me a glass of that clemado with two squirts of Texas Tea and two icecubes. God I was all alone. And I heard the knob rattle. Somebody was rattling the knob. It was the robbers. I just know it was. I don't know how I got through it. I was so scared.

speaker: MOTHER
line: That show is on. Could you make me my hot sandwich so that I could eat my sandwich while I watch my show?

speaker: MOTHER
line: What kind of sandwich is it?

speaker: LUKESH
line: Potted meat.

speaker: MOTHER
line: I don't think I like that. Have I had it before?

speaker: LUKESH
line: Many times.

speaker: LUKESH
line: You love it.

speaker: REYES
line: We should be at the hospital.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Scully will call if he regains consciousness.

speaker: REYES
line: Yeah, I should be there...

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent, you're still under investigation. Not to mention I will be too if anyone finds out that I show you this.

speaker: REYES
line: Erwin Timothy Lukesh?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Have you even seen him before?

speaker: REYES
line: 1995. Patient at the State Psychiatric Hospital at Gaitersburg. Diagnosed with a delusional disorder anger sub-type that presented itself shortly after the suicide death of his father.

speaker: SKINNER
line: After four months, he was deemed fit for release. He lives with his invalid mother in an apartment adjacent to the crime scene.

speaker: REYES
line: What's the story he's telling?

speaker: SKINNER
line: That he heard a bang, went downstairs to investigate, and that he saw you exit the alley.

speaker: REYES
line: This is the one person we know was in the vicinity at the time of shooting. Why would Doggett say his name?

speaker: SKINNER
line: You think Lukesh shot Doggett?

speaker: REYES
line: What if... Doggett was investigating Lukesh. What if... Lukesh is somehow behind all this...

speaker: SKINNER
line: Skinner.

speaker: FOLLMER
line: It's Follmer. You remember the discussion we had yesterday when I asked you to keep me up to date?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I do...

speaker: FOLLMER
line: I'm at Washington Memorial. I'm assuming you're with our prime suspect? Bring her. She's going to talk to Agent Doggett.

speaker: FOLLMER
line: Ah, the gang's all here.

speaker: REYES
line: How is he?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Fully conscious. We set up a communication device designed for spinal injuries............

speaker: FOLLMER
line: Just so we're clear, we ask only the questions I want asked. You're not to try and shade his testimony in any way.

speaker: SKINNER
line: If you're so concerned, why let Reyes talk to him in the first place?

speaker: FOLLMER
line: Because he says he won't talk to anyone but you.

speaker: FOLLMER
line: He didn't mention you two.

speaker: REYES
line: John. Hey there.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: ALIVE>.

speaker: REYES
line: That's right. You're alive. As if there were ever any doubt.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: NO YOU HOW OK>.

speaker: REYES
line: Why I'm alive? Is that what you're asking? I'm fine, John. Why wouldn't I be?

speaker: FOLLMER
line: Have him say who shot him.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: YOU... YOUR THROAT CUT.

speaker: REYES
line: My throat wasn't cut, John, what do you mean?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: LUKESH KILLED YOU. TRIED KILL ME.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: We're going to see if you feel anything. Any sensation at all. Okay, that's enough for today. We'll see if you can feel any better tomorrow.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: 1ST TIME EVER HOPED FOR A LITTLE PRICK>

speaker: REYES
line: You kiss your mother with that mouth?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: HOWS CASE?

speaker: REYES
line: It's coming along. It's nowhere, basically. There's so much that's impossible to reconcile. You say I was on the stakeout with you, I say you were at my apartment bringing me...

speaker: REYES
line: John, do you know a little stand on M Street? Supposed to be really good hot dogs?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: POLISH SAUSAGE. BEST IN CITY>

speaker: REYES
line: John, what if we were both right? What if you were at my apartment, and I was on a stakeout with you at the exact same time. W-what would it take for that to be true?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: WE BOTH HAD TWINS WHICH WE DONT>

speaker: REYES
line: Except maybe we do. Maybe all of us do. You've heard of the idea of a parallel universe? One that's identical, or nearly identical, to our own. One in which we all have a double. It's theoretical physics but... what if it's real?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: TOO MUCH STAR TREK>

speaker: REYES
line: You said yourself Erwin Lukesh was known for his impossible escapes. You said that in the alley you looked away only for an instant and he was gone. And then, somehow, he was behind you. And he shot you. With my gun. My gun, that never left my possession that entire afternoon. What if Lukesh can pass freely from one parallel world to the other? Like... like he's opening a door. And what if somehow you followed him through that door. Without even knowing it. Maybe when you followed Lukesh into this world, my - my Doggett got forced out.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: WOW>

speaker: REYES
line: My Doggett would have called that crazy, too... but give me another theory that fits.

speaker: LUKESH
line: I'm kind of confused as to why I'm back. I already told you everything I know.

speaker: FOLLMER
line: We just had a few... inconsistencies that we need to clear up.

speaker: LUKESH
line: Sure. Dot the I's, cross the T's

speaker: SKINNER
line: Yeah, here's an odd one, for starters. We have an eyewitness that says you shot Agent John Doggett.

speaker: LUKESH
line: That's surprising I can't imagine who would have said that.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Doggett. Yeah, he's regained consciousness. He's very chatty. Among other things, he says that you're a murderer, that you enjoy killing women with a straight razor. And cutting out their tongues.

speaker: LUKESH
line: Yeah. Wow. What a corker.

speaker: FOLLMER
line: Mr. Lukesh, would you consent to a GSR test?

speaker: LUKESH
line: GSR? What is that?

speaker: FOLLMER
line: It can reveal whether or not someone recently fired a gun. You wouldn't mind indulging us, would you?

speaker: LUKESH
line: I don't know. I think I ought to talk to my lawyer about that. Look, my heart goes out to your Agent Doggett. But he's confused. It's clear to me that your female agent, Miss Reyes, is responsible for this terrible tragedy.

speaker: FOLLMER
line: Is there someone who can corroborate your story?

speaker: LUKESH
line: No.

speaker: SKINNER
line: How about your mother? I mean, you live with your mother right?

speaker: LUKESH
line: She was sleeping, she wouldn't have heard anything.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Well, still, maybe she can tell us something. Would she be willing to come down here and talk to us?

speaker: LUKESH
line: My mother is in poor health. She gets confused easily.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Oh, we can go to her

speaker: LUKESH
line: I won't have you harassing her just because you're afraid to admit that one of your people did this! If you're going to arrest me, do it. Otherwise, I'm going home.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Say hi to mama.

speaker: LUKESH
line: Agent Reyes, right? What's the matter? Cat got your tongue?

speaker: REYES
line: How do you do it? You know what I'm talking about, don't you? There's this world, and there's the world where you live out your sick fantasies. When did it start? After your breakdown in 1995? All that anger, it's buttoned up so tight, it had nowhere else to go. It had to get released. Not here. But in a world just like this one.

speaker: LUKESH
line: God, I enjoyed it. You bled just like a pig.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Reyes?

speaker: FOLLMER
line: You all right?

speaker: LUKESH
line: Mama, I'm home. Mama, you want your clemato?

speaker: LUKESH
line: Mama. Have you been out of bed? Mama?

speaker: MOTHER
line: You don't tell me things, Erwin.

speaker: LUKESH
line: I tell you things.

speaker: MOTHER
line: You sneak out of house in night. You leave me alone all by myself. And then you think that I don't know but I know. I know every time. What is it that you do, Erwin, that you don't tell me?

speaker: LUKESH
line: I don't... I don't do you that. I don't know what you mean.

speaker: MOTHER
line: Why is this gun in my house? I opened the drawer. I don't even know how I even picked it up without it going off and killing me. I was so scared.

speaker: LUKESH
line: Mama...

speaker: MOTHER
line: If you won't tell me, you will tell the FBI, that's it. Agents at the FBI have left three messages. They want to talk to me? Can you imagine, Erwin, why would the FBI want to talk to me?

speaker: MOTHER
line: What are you doing? Aren't you even going to listen?

speaker: LUKESH
line: You're going to talk to them?

speaker: MOTHER
line: Well, of course I am, it's the FBI!

speaker: LUKESH
line: Mama.

speaker: MOTHER
line: Don't turn on the waterworks, Mister, it's not going to wash. I'm the one who's been lied to.

speaker: MOTHER
line: Erwin. What are you doing?

speaker: MOTHER
line: Erwin. What are you doing? Erwin. No...

speaker: DOGGETT
line: MISSED A SPOT>

speaker: REYES
line: Did not. Anyway, that's what you get for hiring cheap help.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: BEEN THINKING>

speaker: REYES
line: Thinking about what?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: SOUNDS CRAZY, BUT THINK YOURE RIGHT. 2 DOGGETTS CANT BE IN 1 WORLD. U CAN FIX>

speaker: REYES
line: How?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: PULL THE PLUG.

speaker: REYES
line: Bad joke.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I GO YOUR DOGGETT COMES BACK. CMON YOUR THEORY SOUND>

speaker: REYES
line: My theory is sound? You don't believe a word of it, John, not in a million years would you believe. It has nothing to do with my theory.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: DO U BELIEVE?>

speaker: DOGGETT
line: PROVE IT>

speaker: REYES
line: I would do anything for you. Anything but that.

speaker: REYES
line: Reyes.

speaker: SKINNER
line: It's Skinner, are you okay?

speaker: REYES
line: Yes, sir, I'm fine.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I can't say the same for Marion Lukesh.

speaker: REYES
line: What happened?

speaker: SKINNER
line: She's dead. It's the exact M.O. Doggett described. It looks like a straight razor was used.

speaker: REYES
line: Lukesh killed his mother. Do you have any idea where he is?

speaker: SKINNER
line: No. But if everything I've heard is true, he's not going to be easy to find.

speaker: REYES
line: I think he'll find us.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You all right, Agent Reyes?

speaker: REYES
line: Just a little jumpy, I guess.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's understandable

speaker: FOLLMER
line: Try and take it easy, Monica. We got you covered, coming and going.

speaker: REYES
line: Anything happening out front?

speaker: SKINNER
line: No, you moved to a quiet neighbourhood. It's dead out there.

speaker: REYES
line: I think I'll check around once more.

speaker: LUKESH
line: You want to scream right now, don't you?

speaker: REYES
line: Lukesh.

speaker: LUKESH
line: Parked in a van outside was the FBI. Try and scream out 'em. They can't hear you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where's she gone?

speaker: FOLLMER
line: Monica, do you copy?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Reyes, Agent Reyes, do you read me?

speaker: SCULLY
line: He's in there. He's got to be.

speaker: FOLLMER
line: That's not possible.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And what if it is? Want to stick around to find out?

speaker: CUT BACK TO
line: nan

speaker: LUKESH
line: You ruined everything, you bitch. You made me! You made me do it.

speaker: REYES
line: Lukesh.

speaker: LUKESH
line: Shut up! Shut up! But you know what? This time, I get to bleed you slow.

speaker: FOLLMER
line: You all right? Monica, you all right? It's okay. It's okay. It's over.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Monica, forget about the plates, will you?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What's wrong?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Monica, what's wrong?

speaker: REYES
line: I'm good. Good. In Loving Memory Of RICKY LOYD ARREGUIN January 24, 1985 - September 13, 2001
